intro: Reseda alba var. pentodon, commonly known as white cockle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Reseda alba var. pentodon is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in dyeing and medicinal practices.
